channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: This little-known AI darling is climbing the Fortune 500 faster than any other company
item.description: Super Micro Computer skyrocketed 206 spots on the Fortune 500, thanks to its pivotal role in powering the AI boom.

item.title: The largest Fortune 500 company has 2 million employees. These 8 have under 2,000
item.description: These small but mighty companies on the Fortune 500 raked in more than $87 billion in combined revenue over the past year.

item.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene slams FDA green lighting of mNEXSPIKE COVID-19 vaccine: 'Not MAHA at all!!!'
item.description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene slams FDA green lighting of Moderna's mNEXSPIKE COVID-19 vaccine, describing the move as "Not MAHA at all!!!' in a post on...

item.title: AI-built startups could fuel increase in venture capital ‘zombie’ funds
item.description: The number of zombie VC funds has jumped by 50% since the end of 2021.

item.title: California beach ‘Resist!’ protest pushes ‘kindness’ while calling to ‘86 47’ in anti-Trump message
item.description: Activists in Santa Cruz, California called for “kindness" in a Saturday beach protest against President Trump, then wrote “86 47" in the sand.

item.title: 24 founders still run their Fortune 500 companies. They’re a rarity
item.description: From Nvidia to Airbnb, many of today’s top-performing companies are led by founders who’ve stayed in power for over a decade.

item.title: Women run 11% of Fortune 500 companies in 2025—but progress is still slow
item.description: Fifty-five Fortune 500 companies are led by women CEOs this year.

item.title: Trump's 20th week in office to include White House meeting with European leader, expected call with Xi
item.description: President Donald Trump's 20th week as commander in chief is set to include a meeting with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz and a call with Chinese Pre...

item.title: Think We’ve Seen the Last +1,000-BPS High Yield Spread? Think Again
item.description: Think +1,000-bps high yield spreads are history? Marty Fridson shows why they could still hit that mark in the next recession.

item.title: List of 'sanctuary jurisdictions' removed from U.S. government website
item.description: A list of more than 500 "sanctuary jurisdictions" no longer appears on the Department of Homeland Security's website after receiving criticism for inc...

item.title: Video shows DHS agents detaining Nadler aide outside of congressional office
item.description: Federal agents were shown in a video handcuffing an aide to Rep. Jerry Nadler after authorities accused his staff of "harboring rioters" in his New Yo...

item.title: The Way Forward for Religious Charter Schools After St. Isidore
item.description: Recent disappointment at the Supreme Court doesn’t mean the fight against prohibiting religious-sponsored charter schools should go away. Here’s what ...

item.title: What on Earth Is Wrong with 60 Minutes?
item.description: Scott Pelley’s pious defense of journalism is contradicted by the slow-motion implosion of CBS’s marquee news program.

item.title: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick calls trade court ruling against Trump tariffs 'silly'
item.description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick called a U.S. Court of International Trade ruling that blocked President Trump's global tariffs "silly."

item.title: Progressive caucus chair warns Democrats that Elon Musk is not going away
item.description: Congressional Progressive Caucus Chair Greg Casar cautioned Democrats on Sunday not to believe Elon Musk when the tech billionaire says he is stepping...

item.title: The Commencement Address Harvard Needs
item.description: The university doesn’t need self-referential self-congratulation. It needs introspection of the sort Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn once urged of it.

item.title: Rep. Nadler condemns Trump admin after staff member handcuffed during congressional office security sweep
item.description: A staff member of Rep. Jerry Nadler was handcuffed by DHS officers amid protests, leading to accusations against Trump administration for chaos and in...

item.title: US can’t cut China off completely, but must defend AI and American innovation from nonstop theft: Sen Rounds
item.description: Sen. Mike Rounds discussed U.S. strategies to combat China's intellectual property theft and AI's role in maintaining economic leadership in exclusive...

item.title: This June, Resolve to Celebrate Fidelity
item.description: Affirming the timeless values that continue to sustain this great nation is a better use of the month than what others devote it to.

item.title: House Speaker Mike Johnson says he texted Elon Musk after Musk criticized 'big beautiful bill'
item.description: House Speaker Mike Johnson said Sunday that he reached out to Elon Musk after the tech billionaire criticized the Republicans' "big beautiful bill."

item.title: Summers Before Screens
item.description: Remembering a way of life we’ll never get back

item.title: Study: 83 Percent Of ER Visits Due To Drug-Induced Abortions Miscoded As ’Miscarriages’
item.description: Researchers warn that misclassification could deprive women of the emergent care they need for the serious adverse events linked to abortion.

item.title: SCOTUS Agrees Trump Can Revoke Temporary Legal Status Of 500K Foreign Nationals (For Now)

item.title: Get All Your Shopping Done Now So You Don’t Have To Go Out Till Independence Day
item.description: If you care about the mental or spiritual health of children, don’t shop where pride is sold. Recognize that you are being used.

item.title: MSNBC Repeats Debunked Lie That Not Getting Transgender Hormones Can Kill You
item.description: MSNBC's Katelyn Burns took to dramatic fearmongering on Wednesday that the 'big, beautiful bill' would kill trans-identifying individuals.

item.title: Tariffs, Inflation, and Returns: How Investments Respond to Supply Shocks
item.description: Learn how tariff-related inflation shocks ripple through markets—and which assets have historically helped investors navigate the turbulence.

item.title: Women in Alts: Leading with Inspiration, Intuition, and Impact
item.description: Women investors are redefining alternatives with bold leadership, values-driven decisions, and long-term impact.

item.title: The Downgrade Is Done. The Investor Response Is Just Beginning
item.description: The US downgrade won’t upend markets—but it may reshape sovereign risk models and investor assumptions. Here’s what to watch next.

item.title: Tariffs and Returns: Lessons from 150 Years of Market History
item.description: What 150 years of market data reveal about tariffs, growth, and investment returns—and how equity factors have historically delivered resilience.
